website_summaries.verdict: A quality multifunctional rechargeable headlamp. We love its versatility – use the provided strap, or clip to an existing hat.
pros: Simple design and easy to use
USB charged, so no need to replace batteries
Takes about 2.5 hours to charge fully
Clip to your hat peak, or use the included strap as a headband
Three lighting modes: bright, low, and flashing
cons: Some users think this lamp is useful for close-up projects, but full beam isn't direct or bright enough for outdoor nighttime use

customer_reviews.title: Smooth even flood light
customer_reviews.text: Great flood light for specific purposes. It produces a wide and incredibly even spread of light with no noticeable hot spot. It produces light like you have a 3 foot long fluorescent tube on your head. It doesn't throw very far but the even light works great for close up tasks. Great for working on cars, tying fishing knots, and any close up work where you don't want shadows or bright spots. Also works great for lighting up a tent. Battery doesn't last long and it abruptly shuts off without warning so you need a backup light or you could be stranded. This would be great with a replaceable 18650 battery.
customer_reviews.author: Emergency Outfitters

customer_reviews.title: One of my best picks on amazon
customer_reviews.text: One of my best picks on amazon .....Far left picture iPhone no flash center picture 50% far right picture 100%
customer_reviews.author: JUNIOR

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Charged it two times and after the second time it just turns on and off as if it wasn't charged. Save your money. You will end up throwing this head light away after a couple of uses. Update: after reading instructions on how to reset it, it's been working for months without problems. Good buy, would buy again. Excellent for recharging everyday, lasts about 8 hours on the low setting and maybe 6 hours on full bright. Headlight used daily and recharged daily, works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Button wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: Ok first of all I am a streamlight fan. I carry one with me everyday. But when I ordered my first Streamlight 61702 Bandit the on/off button wouldn't stay on. The light only worked when you pushed the button (Like a momentary switch). So I sent it back and placed an order for another one. Same thing it wouldn't stay on sent it back and received a third same thing. So this time I took it apart and soldered my own switch in. For what you pay for these lights you shouldn't have to fix them when they are new.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.Hearne

customer_reviews.title: Dependable super bright with 2 brightness levels and rechargeable!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Very bright. Decent price. Good dependable and reliable name brand. It’s fantastic for up close and medium distance tasks. It’s ok but not great for distance. So for instance working around in the driveway or on my RV or something it works great. Walking down a trail to my deer stand in pitch black it easily lights up the trail right in front of me but not very far down the trail. But I got it mostly for closer tasks and it’s absolutely perfect for that. Love being rechargeable with standard charge for.
customer_reviews.author: CopperTop

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am a industrial mechanic and set up technician for my day job and a part time auto mechanic. A flashlight is my best friend. These little light are so handy because they let you use 2 hands while working on something. They don't really project a beam of light...more of a flood light, but they let you see in general. I always carry a regular light with me too, in case a need to take a close look at something. Overall, I would definitely buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Nice even light, just doesn't last too long on bright setting
customer_reviews.text: Really nice light. If you want a convenient light that has a nice even field of illumination, this is it. If you want something really bright you should keep looking. You can switch it between a barely useful brightness and a fairly strong light but the battery goes pretty quickly, and when it goes, it is gone. There is no fading of the brightness as the battery dies. When it uses up the charge it turns off. If you are in a dark area with no other source of illumination you could be in trouble. Keep a backup for when the battery dies. Fortunately, the battery charges quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and decent lighting
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lightweight light for my hard hat. This is light weight but the light output isn’t the best, but it’s good enough to let you see what you are doing in the dark. Can’t tell you the battery life of it as I’ve only had it work a week and occasionally use it. I alway charge it via usb cable when I’m done with work. It’s a lightweight light that gives you adequate light in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: dvs-SS

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I don't write to many five star reviews but I am so pleased with this product. I have had it for about 1 1/2 years now and it's still going strong. It is so bright and I use it all the time for projects. I charges quickly and stays on for a reasonable amount of time. It's not perfect though the head band could be made out of a stiffer material because it twists and after awhile you have to untwist it. this is a winner product and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Engelson

customer_reviews.title: I own many excellent quality products made by Streamlight, though this is not one of them
customer_reviews.text: actual size of light is much smaller than pictured. Headband is very light duty and thin....first time I wore it, witin 30 mins the strap came out from buckle ..... I love Streamlight products in general and have purchased many of their flashlights, etc in past, though I must say this headlight, in my opinion, is not what I would consider a streamlight quality product. on off button is very small and difficult to push or find with gloves on or off....switching light modes is not simple.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I love this light when it works
customer_reviews.text: I love this light when it works. But it keeps going into demo/ship mode randomly after full charges and it just flashes. I don't know if I'm doing something wrong but according to directions I'm not? Having a hard time finding the contact on Amazon directly but I will say when the light is functioning properly (still might be user error) it's great. Hoping they'll reach out to me and explain if I have a defective unit or it's a user error, really would like to get the issue fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running while it is dark.
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this. It gives a really good wide beam light that is bright enough to shine well in front of you, but not so bright as to blind you to your surroundings. I love to take early morning jogs, well before the sun comes up, and this works perfectly. It has other settings for other uses as well. The band is comfortable and stays secure...even while moving and jogging. The battery lasts for plenty of time, even for longer jogs. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Steele

customer_reviews.title: The only headlamp I don't hate.
customer_reviews.text: It's the first one I find functional and not overpriced. It's a wide beam, not heavy, not spotty, easily controlled by the switch (I've used some with really stupid on-off-fancy-unnecessary-function switches, and they all suck) The only downside is the non-removable battery needs to be charged by USB. I leave this light in my kit away from charging sources, so I'll leave one in the bag and take the other to charge, then swap, etc. More planning than I'd like, but for the performance and weight, it's a cost I can deal with.
customer_reviews.author: M. Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Too bright
customer_reviews.text: PROS - Great when you're working outside after dark by yourself. For example, working on your car in your driveway. This headlamp floods the area with light. CONS - This is a strange problem to have, but... this headlamp is TOO BRIGHT! I recommend that they re-design it so that the lower light setting is even dimmer. That way this can be used for camping, early morning work crews, etc. As it stands right now, this headlamp is too bright to wear if you are around other people.
customer_reviews.author: Super Top Secret Username

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one week
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, compact design. However, this one failed almost immediately. I didnt get a chance to return it as I was traveling. Surely disappointed in Streamlight. thought they are a good company. I know guys that have the rechargeable handheld torches, maybe that is their forte.
customer_reviews.author: capt jeff shattuck

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but gets warm
customer_reviews.text: I like the light output and weight of this, but here in AZ, the heat this puts out makes it uncomfortable after a short while. Would be 5 stars if they built it so the heat reflected away from the users head instead of towards it. UPDATE: ended up returning - it's simply too uncomfortable from the heat it puts out to use. I thought LEDs were not supposed to heat up?
customer_reviews.author: MTC

customer_reviews.title: Hack to attach headband
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product, but I couldn't get the headband attached following Streamlight's directions. So, I took a heavy duty paper clip; straightened one end and inserted the looped end of the paperclip from outside the lamp housing; once the looped end cleared the inside of the "ear" I attached the headband to the looped end and pulled it through. Took a bit of effort but it worked. Basically, I used the paperclip to "fish" the headband through the ears working from outside to inside, then back out.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is awful. I bought two of these headlamps in order to have one on the charge when not in use. At the end of a 8hr day and they can not keep up. There are two lighting modes. The low mode is insufficient. The bright mode provides adequate lighting for my automotive work, but in this mode it is dead before I finish one job.
customer_reviews.author: Jgeezy

customer_reviews.title: This is one AWESOME little lamp
customer_reviews.text: This is one AWESOME little lamp. can't beat the warranty, super bright (white flood only), very thin and streamline, lightweight and extremely versatile. comes with very comfortable and thin head strap along with a hat clip TWO THUMBS UP! i bought this for the reason that while i'm in cam, i don't have to run my batteries low on all my other lamps that i use while out on the hunt or backpacking. i love the fact that it's rechargeable. and at $20... you just CANNOT top that! super great quality. i'm excited to use this backpacking this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Marly

customer_reviews.title: Favorite headlight except short runtime!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll begin by saying this is my favorite headlight to use! The light illuminates such a wide area that you can easily work on projects in dark areas without having to move your head excessively to light it up! If your eyes can see it it’s lit up! The negative is that the battery doesn’t last near long enough! Two-three times more run time would be reasonable! Even the run times listed would be great! My work around is to have two! One charging and one in use! Three in rotation might be better, but we’ll try two for now!
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and SUPER bright!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an el-cheapo head light for a few years, and it was generally adequate, I thought. Got this as a gift and it's a whole different ball game now. The cheap kind lit up what i was looking at, but this thing (if you want it it) lights up the whole work area. It's pretty stunning how bright it gets on the high setting, and you can conserve the battery using the low setting (which still performs better than a typical cheap headlamp). What a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ZacTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for close-up work
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, even light for close-up to mild distance - probably a couple of hours max battery life on high beam - perfect for many situations - wouldn't make it through a day of work, but I haven't actually tested it for that - easily worth the price - fits many situations I use it for - very light-weight - excellent as a supplement to a headlamp with a more concentrated beam
customer_reviews.author: Pigs

customer_reviews.title: amazing EDC light for me
customer_reviews.text: Overall, amazing EDC light for me. As a headlamp, the strap is a bit thin and therefore weight of the light causes it to sag. This light is SUPER lightweight, it's just the band is thin in profile and therefore doesn't have the strength. Others have mentioned the the light will just shut off when the battery is depleted; I experienced this, but after the 7-8th use. I was using this to inspect homes (i.e. crawlspaces, attics, dark corners of basements) so 8 uses is great.
customer_reviews.author: Scharfschutzen

customer_reviews.title: Rechargable, streamlight quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: Read this first!!! Charge it! I was really disappointed when I ripped this out of the packaging and it only stayed on when I hit the button. I couldn’t believe it, so I went where no man has dared to go, and... Read The Instructions! It clearly says they ship it in “try me” mode, go figure. Once fully charged, it automatically goes to normal operation. One click on, click and hold again for brighter, click again for off. Super bright, like expected from streamlight. Nice quality, also expected. Overall, nice light, really nice that it’s rechargable with any android charger(micro usb)(comes with one)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W

customer_reviews.title: It's good within its limits
customer_reviews.text: I inspect properties. I clip it to my ball cap visor below my Go-Pro mount when I go under a house or into a dark attic. It's lightweight and movable, which I like. I would not consider it for a bike light or night hike. I becomes too dim for my use after continuous half-hour on bright setting. Turning it on and off activates the blink function, which I could do without. Overall, it's a good, rechargeable cap light.
customer_reviews.author: Ol Terrier

customer_reviews.title: Love the form factor and COB emitter
customer_reviews.text: Love the form factor and COB emitter. Battery life is not great, but that comes with the form factor. Obviously there's a trade off between the beam spread and brightness. You're not really going to be night hiking with this, but it's great for use in/around camp (close work), working under cars, etc. ** UPDATE ** Battery self-discharges in a couple of days (which would be very odd if it's a LiPo cell...) so it's likely this thing is going to be dead when you want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: stardust

customer_reviews.title: Very bright while it lasted... which was less than a minute.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, but given that the first one crapped out -- as in broke, not as in battery died -- less than a minute after completing its first full charge gives me zero confidence in the other. The return window is past, so I'm just tossing them in the trash, and will think twice before buying anything else from Streamlight.
customer_reviews.author: Holden Caulfield

customer_reviews.title: Best Task Headlight you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Been using this one for a few years, as an early adopter. Battery life is not as long, but its worth it. Light doesn't go gray, just turns off, so its always 100% or nothing.. When its on, its the best task headlamp you can buy. By far. Bright, wide light like no other. Truly new tech.
customer_reviews.author: Skipatroller

customer_reviews.title: Good hands free work light
customer_reviews.text: Always like stream light products have several I’ve had this for around a year it still holds charge well but I don’t like the fact you can’t replace the battery but it’s held up good I use it a lot cheap durable rechargeable bright flood light in immediate work vicinity but not a long distance spot light
customer_reviews.author: buddy

customer_reviews.title: bright light
customer_reviews.text: This has a good flood light effect. It really is not for long distance visibility, but it will light up the area your in. I put this on my hardhat at work and I can clearly see a good 10 feet in a 180 deg viewing area in a dark space. Biggest bonus is, its usb rechargeable and only takes 20 minutes at most to recharge and lasts days.
customer_reviews.author: Dicktopia

customer_reviews.title: Great lights for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little light. I hook mine to my hat yo give me an edge in the dark when my hands are full of gear, leashes etc. the light is quite bright and I’m happy I bought two of them because the only downside is the battery dies faster than I anticipated. I keep two charged so I have a backup. But all in all I’m pleased with these little hat lights.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rumble

customer_reviews.title: Good for task lighting
customer_reviews.text: Very useful if you want to light up an area directly in front of you. I use it for things like working in electrical panels or above drop ceilings. If you need to be able to see any sort of distance you'll want something else. The light is very spread out. It's bright, it's just isn't focused at all. The clip is good; I have no fear of it falling off the brim of my hat. Battery life is acceptable. Not awesome, but not horrible. I would charge it after each use to make sure it doesn't die on you in the middle of working on something.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Best headlamp I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I’m an automotive technician. Love it for seeing what I’m doing hands free. Got a second one for work to use while the other is charging. Then I got one to run with at night. Then I got one for my dad to use while grilling. Super light, love that it’s rechargeable. Beam goes far and doesn’t just light up one spot. Best headlamp I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The best head light I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was broke first. The buttons wouldnt work properly. Then I read the directions. It must be charged fully first to get the different light modes to turn on, and leave demo mode. The design is great. It sits on top of the bill, not under which I prefer. The bill clamp is super tight. It's not falling off ever. The field of light is perfect. The low light mode is good for me for regular use. Tonight I needed extra light to walk through mud, and the high mode is fantastic. I had to come review it.
customer_reviews.author: One with Power

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight, bright, short throw, USB rechargeable headlamp.
customer_reviews.text: It's bright and has a very wide diffuse beam for close-up work, like working on a car, piddling around camp, or reading a book. However, it has a very short throw, so I wouldn't wear this on a run or a bike ride, especially because there is no low-battery indication. You'll need a backup flashlight in most cases.
customer_reviews.author: ThrowinStacks

customer_reviews.title: Steamlight make great lights
customer_reviews.text: This clip light is exactly what I need for getting in and out of the woods when deer hunting. It's is very bright and casts a broad beam. Have been using it on the bill of my hat so can't say too much about the headband but I will say it appears that it will fall off you head easily. The light has some weight to it and the band is thin and has no band that goes over the top of the head to keep it from falling down.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: It's light and rechargeable which is cool. I ended up attaching it to my dogs ...
customer_reviews.text: It's really bright, but only illuminates 6 to 12 inches from your face. I am an automotive technician and it does very little to illuminate the engine bay 2 feet from my head. It's light and rechargeable which is cool. I ended up attaching it to my dogs collar when we go for walks at night. It's just not very functional is at work light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective! I'm really impressed!
customer_reviews.text: For the price ($13.00) this is a really nice little headlamp for those jobs around the house that only take a few minutes. I don't think it would last very long but it does put out a perfect amount of light for those times you need to have your hands free and need light. At a sub $20 price I'd give this 5 stars for value. Any more than that and I would look at headlamps with bigger batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer Dude

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you are somewhat technical this is a great little light. By technical I mean have usb ports readily available in your life. Yes on high it will use up the cell in an hour or so. But myself I use it on low mostly for 20 to 30 min and then put it on the charger to my next job. It does exactly what it's advertised to do. It weighs almost nothing and is great if not changing out an engine in a car and this is your only light.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very cool hat light
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great little light I highly recommend It. But I also do recommend putting it on a hat and not taking it off again I charge mine right on the hat as a little connectors in the back could be a little stronger but it does last a long time and it’s still my favorite little clamp on light
customer_reviews.author: baddog

customer_reviews.title: Very bright  great wearable head light
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one accident, was looking at head lights fell asleep thought nothing happened. Few days go by and receive this light in the mail. Not even the least bit upset about it. It's a great little light. It's comfortable to wear you almost forget you have it on. Has different light settings dim to bright and the bright is bright. Has a strobe mode. It charges with a micro USB cord everyone has them but it comes with one too . Battery holds for a long time, would be a great light for an emergency kit either for your house or car. Can either be worn on the band it comes with or on the bill of a hat
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Like turning on the lights
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little light. I love that it's rechargeable as similar predicts can eat batteries in a short time. It fits nicely unlike some other I have used that don't contore to the shape of my forehead. As a mechanic I use headlights everyday and this thing will illuminate a large area under the vehicle. One thing about this light is that it is not a spot light but more of a lantern type of light illuminating a large area. This is perfect for working in dark areas but may not be suited for the outdoorsman.
customer_reviews.author: Kenton

customer_reviews.title: Bright and small light well known brand, gopd price!
customer_reviews.text: This light worked awesome! I used it to light up a 10x8 shed that i was putting stuff in with no problems at all,with the highest setting it lit up the shed very well. And the price was good,its rechargeable via micro usb cable,kinda wished that i could change the batteries myself cause once the battery is done,the light is done. But no problem with that it,ill just buy another good product
customer_reviews.author: lalo

customer_reviews.title: Super bright
customer_reviews.text: Very bright, however it does not focus on a specific spot, it more or less lights up the entire area which is perfect for what I do. Light weight, and smaller then your average wrist watch. Ok downfall, light does not hold a charge very long. You WILL have to recharge this light every day before use even if your using the medium setting.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect general use head lamp
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for in a head lamp to free up my hands. Simple low beam, high beam, off switch. No hitting buttons trying to cycle to the right setting. No wasting countless batteries since its rechargeable. Able to tilt to adjust to my needs or clip to my hat. Battery life long enough to complete most tasks without going dead.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Great little light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent head light. Light weight and very bright. Also clips securely onto the brim of a baseball cap which turned out to be a very nice option as head bands often get stretched and wear out over time. I use occasionally while repairing hard to see or reach items, above ceilings or in confined spaces.
customer_reviews.author: bklnfan

customer_reviews.title: Get 2
customer_reviews.text: This is a good light. But for aggressive use on high setting your going to want 2 It's been close to 8 months and daily use broke one of the hat clips (I use them on a hat) Order a few hat clips they take time to ship in. When one goes off the other is charged as long as one is charging I have yet to be left without light
customer_reviews.author: David b

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these about a year ago. They are used, drained and charged at least once a day five days a week. I've noticed one has begun to not last as long as it used to, so I just bought a third. Is it perfect? No. Do I wish the charge lasted longer? Yes. Do I wish one wasn't starting to be "worn out" after 15 months? Yes. However, when I consider how lightweight it is and how inexpensive it is, I have to say I think it is just fine!! I maintain a fleet of delivery vehicles and have use of a headlight an average of 4.5 hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: TheMechanic

customer_reviews.title: Good light for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Great bright and wide pattern light but as others have said, when the battery runs low, it just shuts itself off without warning. I get a couple hours of use between charges but i do enjoy it for the little jobs around the house or using it to walk in and out of my tree stand for hunting. Overall, it's a nice light for the small price i paid and it feels nearly weightless on my head.
customer_reviews.author: Devin J. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Compact workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, I love how they don't exaggerate the output. Works all day on low power mode, nice wide flood. Compact. Recharges on micro USB. Awesome. Don't expect miracles, the battery is tiny so on high power it will only last about two hours. I lost my first one, ordered another to replace it, I found the first one in the grass after 3 days in the rain, still works perfectly!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yeainheard

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot at work. I work night shift as an aircraft mechanic and this is much better quality than the many I've used before that take AAA batteries. The few times that I use it long enough to drain the battery, I keep my Coast headlamp as a backup. For $20, this is as good of a Streamlight product as their flashlights.
customer_reviews.author: Wilshaw B

customer_reviews.title: Look Ma! No batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I like this little light but it’s got one limiting factor...2 hours. It will deliver blinding light from the moment it comes on until it just stops, doesn’t dim or flicker one bit, it just shuts off when it needs a recharge which also takes a couple of hours. However the convenience of not having batteries saves time, money, and waste.
customer_reviews.author: MNYM8KR26

customer_reviews.title: #1 Light that I have found for LED, rechargable and reasonablly priced.
customer_reviews.text: I went looking for a rechargeable LED headlamp, without spending more the $30. The new COD Led strip light is absolutely fantastic. I have about 9 hours of use with it and have recharged it once. This beats the Energizer lamps, and the Petzels, and Black Diamond headlamps I have. It is a broad flood light, and extremely bright on HI. I could not be more pleased with this light after doing a comparison of multiple models.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas in Wa

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: wont last 2 hours on low on the job.. it dies out so quick..
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It’s a stream light what’s more to say
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am very impressed by the brightness of this head lamp. It’s great for working on anything that requires light and two hands. I use mine for maintenance at work and it allows me to see what I am doing and what I am working on as If I was using a high powered flashlight. The battery life is decent for its size, and it charges fairly quick.
customer_reviews.author: Roger LaCour

customer_reviews.title: Not super bright
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the product is really good, just the amount of light that it gives off is not very much. Purchased it to work at an automotive shop, under the hood of cars or other situations, the brightness of the light does not get it. Perhaps if it was used at night in a camping situation it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Must have, great throw. Very natural to the human eye, intelligent settings. Id put one everywhere and share these with friends and even use them as gifts. Update, bought more as gifts. Bought another to replace my original since the screw for the cap mount went missing, I used the strap from the new one to convert the original lamp as a headlamp and use the new one as a cap lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for outdoorsman
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect light for camping, fishing and arriving late to set up. Multiple brightness settings and options for mounting. The recharge feature makes it a light you will use liberally. Excellent quality and very light.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bright Light!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing light that really shines! Bought two of these for my kids as well they liked them so well - totally BLINDING light! Easy to switch between high/low/flashing modes. Only negative is they get warm - borderline HOT while pressed against your forehead. Also, they die instantly without warning when the battery runs dead.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually getting in excess of 6hrs of use from this little super light weight light. As an LED, I don't think the light travels quite as far as the AA version with the [halogen?] bulbs, but for close work use, I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Clean even light with no hotspot
customer_reviews.text: I am a home inspector. I carry an expensive tactical light. But I need a light I can use hands free to take covers of of heaters in attics, and move across rafters, etc. It is a great light for task lighting. And great when I need to take pictures of issues. Run time is great between charges. I wear it on the bill of a cap, and I don't even know it is there
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Streamlight Product! Super Bright!
customer_reviews.text: Stream light does it again with the Bandit LED Headlight! I love the way Streamlight produces such an amazing amount of rich bright light through such a compact and super affordable design! Streamlight continues the affordability past the point of purchase to the cost of operation by eliminating the batteries and making The Bandit rechargeable! The bright Bandit boasts three different lighting modes. Two brightness levels as well as a strobe mode. Awesome headlight! Perfectly fits my needs! Thank you Streamlight for another great product at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas reid watson

customer_reviews.title: Charge port doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this product, I do; it has a great beam and it's very comfortable but I have now gone through two of these in the past 3 months because the charge port fails and it becomes impossible to charge. I'm not sure if it's a batch problem or what considering my first light lasted just over 2 months but the one I bought to replace it only lasted a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: That1guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great for close range vision
customer_reviews.text: Works great for close range vision. Working in the dark is no problem. As far as working all night with it I am not sure. But for a couple hours to do chores early in the morning works great. I think the manual said something like 2 or 3 hours of life on high and 8 or 10 hours on low? Low setting still does a great job. I would not hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Fiegen

customer_reviews.title: I like it for work at night.
customer_reviews.text: I work as maintenance at night so I use this headlamp every day. I run it on low and charge it every other day. I probably use it about 4-5 hours a nite. Iys not super bright but its efficient. On high its bright af. But I'd imagine I probably would only get a couple hours. It's strap is not as thick as the Energizer one that I since retired. And is very light. At the price it's a no brainer. I just wish the USB cord to charge it was longer. It's only about 3 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: Its super lightweight, fit and finish is great just like everything else streamlight makes. Low mode is nice for working on stuff up close where you dont need a ton of light splashing back at you, but high mode puts out just enough to see where your walking in the dark or something, its perfect for sliding under a rally car on a quick service too!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sanguinetti

customer_reviews.title: A Great, Bright light!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Every bit as great as I expected from Streamlight. Nice and bright, and light enough that I'll be wearing it on the bill of my cap when I'm tunneling into an electrical panel. It's rated to run for 2 hours on high power, and 9+ hours on low, so it will easily make it through a typical day with no problem. Now I wonder if I should buy a few more as Christmas gifts?
customer_reviews.author: Bob Renz

customer_reviews.title: Cool little light
customer_reviews.text: I use it for work (Honda technician) and it is great for hands free working. Not intrusive at all. Barely notice it’s there most of the time. I even convinced other coworkers to start using one. They all love the freedom it offers.
customer_reviews.author: Quickhondaz

customer_reviews.title: Second Purchase of this Light!
customer_reviews.text: Great All Around Headlamp and Small Foot Print. Brightness is Much Better than Previously Own Head Lamps. Battery 🔋 Life is what Should be Expected from this Compact Form Factor. Of Course You get More Use Not Running the Light on High Power. The Quality of Light is Awesome!! Very Impressed; So Impressed with this Light!! This is My Second Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrick Banks

customer_reviews.title: Great light at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I use it for law enforcement purposes and I can't say enough good about this little light. It fits in my duty belt with the hat clip but I usually wear it on my outter vest. It provides an intense wide light and lasts a good while before needing a recharge. I highly recommend this light to LEOs and adventurers alike.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Light in the dark
customer_reviews.text: Work great I use every night 30mins I use it on the low setting I have to plug it in once a week It clips in my hat brim for my work out
customer_reviews.author: Edward R

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Was really pleased with this at first as I love Streamlight but 2 months is all I got out of it. Now it just always strobes like the led is going out
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: ... have purchased other stream light products and have been pleased overall. This light is extremely light and bright
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased other stream light products and have been pleased overall. This light is extremely light and bright. However why I am giving 2 stars, the light functions perfect in household temperatures. However on a recent trip the temperature of the light dropped to around 30 F and the battery went from fully charged to dead. I have had no such experience with other stream light products.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint
customer_reviews.text: No joke HVAC tech here. This thing works well and it’s so light. The hat clip might look dumb but when your in a crawl space or attic who cares. I would probably recommend getting 2-3 if these guys to have on the truck. I’m glad Streamlight is stepping up their game again. Like the control. First click is in low. Reducing the use of mistakenly using high mode.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Best helmet light yet!
customer_reviews.text: This light works great for electrical work in the mill. I velcro'ed it to helmet bill for hands-free light. There's no messing with batteries, it charges off an USB cable. 2 levels of illumination gives plenty of light in a tight space and it hinges down to aim at your work.
customer_reviews.author: Temp

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for working in cramped spaces with low light. Good for camping too. Just don’t expect it to work like a spot light. It’s more like a gentle flood light, that excels in a situation where you need both hands to work on something. I bout t because it’s USB rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: T-Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great little light.
customer_reviews.text: Loving this little light so far. Have found unexpected uses for it while doing a variety of repair jobs. It's ability to be separated from the headband is a definite plus. It has plenty of light for my needs. Happy. Another winner from Streamlight.
customer_reviews.author: Utah #1

customer_reviews.title: I can charge it using my buttocks.
customer_reviews.text: This light is fantastic. It's a flood light, not a spot light, so it's not going to do distance like a headlamp from Black Diamond, but it's great for working or bopping around camp. The light is very slim and comfortable to wear - approximately the size of two chapstick tubes next to each other. Charges from any USB. 3 light modes. All the specs on the site are accurate so far as I can tell - runs for about 2 hours on high (and doesn't lose brightness, eventually just turns off). Takes about 2 hours to charge. Wiggle waggle win, son
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for finding stuff in the freezer
customer_reviews.text: My big upright freezer has no inside light, so finding items in it, especially in the evening, was a challenge. This little light now lives on top of the freezer, and I can now find exactly what I am looking for, even if it is clear in the back.
customer_reviews.author: sbwertz

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of streamlight and have several of their flashlights and headlamps, this is my least favorite headlamp -an hour or two on the battery is just not long enough -It is light and small and if you just need 30-40 minutes of light it might work great for you
customer_reviews.author: lolly

customer_reviews.title: Great Light
customer_reviews.text: Bright, durable (survived a night outside in the rain), and love the recharging feature. I have another head lamp that uses batteries which can be beneficial. But this is a nice light that casts a broad beam of light.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Truitt Jr

customer_reviews.title: Short lived life
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product immensely, right up to the point that it started malfunctioning about 6 weeks after I bought it. I really have a high opinion of Streamlight in general. Now when I turn it on it flashes incessantly. I rely on head band flashlights because of my partial blindness and this malfunction is not good
customer_reviews.author: Richard Perdue

customer_reviews.title: great light i would buy again and again
customer_reviews.text: a great broad beam, great compact size and adequate battery life for a day of work as a mechanic when used on low when under a dash or in a tight area.
customer_reviews.author: guineson

customer_reviews.title: rechargeable!  awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this is so compact! I work in construction and do automotive maintenance and the ability to clip it to my hat is awesome. I have light where I'm looking. And unlike Soooooo many others its re chargeable which means I dont have to go looking for batteries when the light goes out. I would recommend just getting two of them so you can charge one and use another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little light
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great my husband's a mailman and he charges it in the car on the way to work it's super bright and he doesn't have to keep buying batteries
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn’t last long enough.
customer_reviews.text: I am a marine mechanic. I work down in dark cramped engine rooms daily. Light works good. It’s very bright and compact comfortable to wear. I just wish the battery life lasted longer. 2-3 hrs at best. It does charge up pretty fast though.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Kacenski

customer_reviews.title: Durable, useful and great features.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this as a Christmas gift. It’s water proof, can clip to his hat and gives him plenty of light for outdoor work at night, camping tasks and more. He plans to get a second for his car. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a wide veriety of things such as taking my dog on walks at night, hiking, working on my car, and late night fishing. Battery lasts for a decent time depending on how bright you set it and having a rechargeable battery is really nice on a light like this.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Bright and compact
customer_reviews.text: The light clips easily to a hat brim. The light is nice and bright with a very wide beam which is handy when trying to work. The beam range is short but that's what I have flashlights for. I like that the battery is rechargeable from a USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Aubin

customer_reviews.title: I will definitely purchase another one or two for gifts and backups.
customer_reviews.text: I love this light. I work at night and have worn it around my neck to work every night since I received it. It's super bright and allows me both hands to work with and not have to hold a flashlight.

customer_reviews.title: Best headlight for night work
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best and brightest headlamp. Having a good pattern is much more beneficial over a focused beam. Especially for working at night. And being rechargable is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Rex Williams

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY STREAMLIGHTS.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I work on cars for a living. Seems like there is never enough light in the shop. Especially working down low on cars. Or in wheel wells. Or underside and under hood. It's compacts. Throws a lot of light. Comes with straps or clip on to hat.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight compact.
customer_reviews.text: Nice rechargeable product. Negative? When in a tight spot working on boat most lights would kind of give notice by slowly dimming when running down on power. This unit just shuts off without notice. Carry a back up of some sort so you won't be in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: nick a pigati

customer_reviews.title: Get for night time chores.
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased this light before and it got misplaced on a camping trip. So we purchased two more. That are great for doing night time chores. We used them for walking our dogs, getting wood, feeding live stock, camping, and fishing.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca hood

customer_reviews.title: Great light, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great light, I purchased several, and mounted them on my welding helmets, the extra light is super useful at times. I also have one on a hat by the bed for dealing with pests in the night so that I can have my hands free for other pest elimination tools...
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. I recently used this at work for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. I recently used this at work for a full 10+ hours, cleaning up flood water that took down the lighting in the same area. Clip for my hat worked great. Really like that it recharges with USB. Great price for how handy this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: coolnames

customer_reviews.title: Awesome running light!
customer_reviews.text: The wife and i just went running with this and another foxelli usb lamp, the streamlight wins hands down for running. The foxelli is good, but the beam is focused, which means is bounces around and is distracting. The streamlight in contrast is a diffuse flood. It was bright enough for running but I don't think it would have enough throw for biking.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sleeper

customer_reviews.title: Could be brighter. Could last longer.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough battery for a nightshift medic. Not bright enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: Only worked one time.
customer_reviews.text: Went to use it for only the second time but it wouldn't come on. Charged it and still wouldn't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Keith S.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I use headlamps for work all the time. For some reason the charge on this just does not last. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

product_meta.title: Streamlight 61702 Bandit - Includes Headstrap, Hat Clip and USB Cord, Black - 180 Lumens,Black w/ White LED
product_meta.description: The Bandit USB headlamp is an Ultralight weight, weather resistant, personal area/work light featuring a large button for easy actuation, and a Lithium polymer rechargeable battery. A rubber Plug keeps dirt and debris out of the micro USB charging port. It includes a handy snap in hat clip adaptor to attach the light on the Brim of a baseball cap or to add additional downward adjustability when using the headband.
feature_bullets: Snap in hat clip adaptor included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars900 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
